resources.string: Acquire {itemName}
Craft {itemName} at your camp
Defeat {targetName}
Destroy {targetName}
Defeat {targetName} for {itemName} at {POITags}
Search chests for {itemName} at {POITags}
Holding item to transport
Travel to {POITags}
A drowned rat sailor we have here, don't we? \n\nStill, better off than the rest of your crew, I'll wager.
"Who are you?"
Name's Linch. I'm down here from the First Light Settlement. \n\nWanted to assess the impact of that "storm" that wrecked your ship.
"I'm {playerName}."
Well {playerName}, it's a pleasure to meet you, even under such ugly circumstances.
The Restless Drowned
"What makes Aeternum so special?"
Death itself is a different creature here, and a finicky one. \n\nYou've come back to life unscathed, but your crewmates and those from other ships weren't so lucky.
"What happened to them?"
They'll be wandering the beach as the soulless Drowned now. Right thing is to try and put them back to rest. \n\nIt's... better if you do it.
It's ugly business, I know, so best to just get it done with.
Defeat the Drowned at the shipwreck of Ducan's Docket. Talk to Watcher Linch at the First Light Watchtower when your task is complete.
Open the Map (default: [M])
Investigate the Shipwreck
Defeat {targetName}
I know it wasn't a pleasant task, but it was the right thing. \n\nHelps protect the First Light settlement too. The Drowned sometimes wander quite aways.
Basics of Survival
"Are there any supplies available?"
I'm sorry {playerName}, where are my manners? \n\nYou're probably cold, exhausted, and half-starved after what you been through!
"I'll be all right."
Don't go playing tough now. You need learn how to survive out here. \n\nGather some Flint and Wood and make yourself a Skinning Knife at the fire.
There you go. You've got an eye for this, it seems. \n\nNow's time to make yourself a little feast.
Flint and Wood, that is what you are looking for. \n\nThen bring them back here and use my campsite to craft that Flint Skinning Knife.
Gather Flint and Wood, then craft a Flint Skinning Knife at the campfire. Talk to Watcher Linch at the First Light Watchtower when your task is complete.
Collect Materials
Search the ground for {itemName}
Gather {itemName} from a nearby Bush
Craft a {itemName} at Watcher Linch's camp
A Fine Meal
Mm-hm. These boars around here can be right vicious, but they make for a fine meal. \n\nHunt one down, butcher it up, and cook yourself some rations.
"Sounds great."
Mm, my mouth is watering just thinking about those steaks. \n\nBeats having hardtack any day of the week.
Hunt a boar and cook the meat to make some rations. Talk to Watcher Linch at the First Light Watchtower when your task is complete.
Hunt a {targetName}
Equip a Skinning Knife
Skin a Boar to Collect {itemName}
Cook a Light Ration from the Health Recovery category at Watcher Linch's campfire
Nothing beats the smell of fresh meat on an open fire, does it? I'm starting to get right hungry myself. \n\nAt any rate, now you can at least feed yourself.
Splinters on the Shore
"Why is the storm such a problem?"

That storm was Corruption - pure evil. Takes out any ship approaching, and any tries to leave. \n\nBut this one today was the worst I've seen - your ship was just one of many to get smashed, and we need to check each of them.
"What are we looking for?"

It's tradition in First Light to keep record of all the shipwrecks on this shore, a memorial of sorts.\n\nGo on out, look for any legacy items you can scrounge. And if there's any Corruption lingering, steer clear of it!
This is the first time I've been down to this beach in quite a while. \n\nFunny enough, not much has changed. More shipwrecks, more boars. That's about it.

Ah, these'll do perfect. You've done a good turn for the memory of those ships, and for First Light.\n\nI wish we could just head back to the settlement now, but we can't turn a blind eye to the truth.
Search shipwrecks near the First Light Watchtower for any records or remnants, and watch out for signs of Corruption.
Search Shipwrecks for Records and Remnants
From Kain's Knot:
Collect Ship's Roster
Collect Ship's Manifest
Collect Ship's Log
Search Ship's Locker at wreck of {POITags}
From Sal's Schooner:
Collect the {itemName} from the Stern
Collect the {itemName} from the Bow
Investigate {POITags}
Search for the source of the Corruption
Defeat the {targetName}
Hold the Line
"The Corruption's still around?"
Yes, and Corruption's the real threat to watch for. Any trace is a scourge to the settlement. \n\nI fear some remnant may be lingering in Tideswallow cave.
"You want me to check it out?"
I hate to ask a newcomer, but you handle yourself well enough. \n\nGo take a look, then. Be warned though, Corruption can be right dangerous.
If you venture into Tideswallow Cave, be careful. Whatever's in there, it's not good.
Explore Tideswallow Cave, deal with what you find, and report back to Watcher Linch at the First Light Watchtower.
My hunch was right, wasn't it? \n\nThere was Corruption in that cave. You're brave to have dealt with it.
Storms on the Horizon
"The settlement should be warned."

string.comment: female referring to female Constable Oakes)
string.speaker: Watcher Linch - First Light
string.name: WatcherLinch

resources.string: You're right, of course. The folks at the settlement should start making preparations. This could get right ugly. \n\nThe Constable should hear about this straightaway.
"Should I take the message?"
Yes, {playerName}. You've done as much as I could ask down here. \n\nGive Constable Oakes this message, and then take a well-deserved rest. You've earned it.
It's always a treat to see a new face. \n\nWhether you are new to Aeternum or simply from another settlement, you are welcome to First Light.
"I have a message from Watcher Linch."
Oh dear, then the storm we saw out there was as bad as it seemed. \n\nThe Shattered Mountain has erupted as well. Linch said this day would come. It seems she was right.
While I do appreciate the company here, Constable Oakes must be informed of these events.\n\nBe certain to stay on the path when traveling to the settlement.
Travel to the First Light Settlement and convey Watcher Linch's warning to Constable Oakes.
The Old Man Who Cried Corruption
Search for an old man along the river in Monarch's Bluffs. He may know more about fighting Corruption.
"What crazy old man?"
Oh, it was decades ago. He was stark, raving mad, but kind of sweet at the same time.\n\nI heard a rumor he was wandering around Monarch's Bluffs these days. He's probably become Lost by now.
Are you still looking for that crazy old hermit? \n\nI heard recently that he is indeed in Monarch's Bluffs.
Complete Quests to Help the Settlement before Seeking the Old Man
(Optional) Use Your Map to Fast Travel to the Spirit Shrine
Search for the Mysterious Old Man in {POITags}
Inform the Magistrate
"Alright. Anything else?"
I'll begin formulating a strategy. We shouldn't rush into anything. \n\nI take it you are {playerName}, to whom Watcher Linch referred in her message?
"Yes, that's me."
Then the settlement is already in your debt. \n\nIf you will, please inform Magistrate Bond of this news, and then visit the inn. We all need our rest, don't we?
You'll have to forgive me - a bit busy just now. \n\nFirst the storm, then Shattered Mountain, and I'm getting no direction or help whatsoever.
"The Constable asked me to share this message."
Oakes sent you? Better late than never, I guess. Let's see...\n\nHmmph! Don't suppose she gave any further instruction, did she? Typical. She probably needs to 'consider her plan'.
Again, you are most welcome to First Light. Speak with Magistrate Bond when you can.
Tell Magistrate Bond about the threat of Corruption. Talk to Constable Oakes in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
Settling In
"I'll help if I can."
Good. The Constable doesn't realize the urgency here, but I do. \n\nWe must get to work straightaway! You're {playerName}? Sounds like you're capable enough.
"The Constable said I should visit the inn first."
Of course she did. Very well. I suppose that makes sense. \n\nCheck-in with Innkeep Fairfax and get a room. Go quickly though - there's no time to waste!
Check in at the Inn
There you are! I was worried I might've run you off! \n\nI'm sorry if I seem overly-hasty. It's just that this really is an emergency!
"It's alright. I understand."
See? You get it! Why doesn't Constable Oakes? \n\nI do hope you'll stick around.
It really is quite simple. Speak with Innkeep Fairfax to acquire a room. Unless you prefer to live in another settlement, I suppose!
Speak with Innkeep Fairfax and bind yourself to the Settlement. Talk to Magistrate Bond in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
Trader's Market
"What happened?"

It's aâ€¦ long story, but indeed, once our markets were packed solid.\n\n You should visit the Trading Post yourself to see the current state of things. Check out the storage space available to you as well.
Open the Storage Shed
Open the Trading Post
As you see, it may have lost its luster, but we have everything one could need in First Light. \n\nWith decisive action, we can make this territory stronger than ever.
Visit the Trading Post and the Storage Shed. Do be quick about it.
Visit the Trading Post and then view your available storage space in the Storage Shed. Talk to Magistrate Bond in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
Constable's Orders
"Maybe she's got a plan now."

I should certainly hope so! Sylvia's had enough time to develop her strategy. \n\nPlease, go and inquire as to her intentions. If she still has nothing to say, feel free to hover about until she does.
Have you spoken with Constable Oakes yet? She rarely leaves the Town Hall, so she'll be simple to find. Up the stairs, and look for the building flying banners.
You should meet Constable Oakes in the First Light Settlement.
Ah, {playerName}! It's nice to see you again! \n\nI hope you're enjoying your time in First Light, despite all these fears about the Corruption.
"Do you have a plan?"
Ha! Magistrate Bond is getting impatient, isn't she? \n\nAlways driven to action - it's one of her strengths. But sometimes, we need to think first.
Slow and Steady
"I can help gather supplies."
That's the spirit. Even under dire circumstances, slow and steady is the course. \n\nI would welcome your help. Gather wood, stone, and rawhide and then refine them. Every little bit helps.
Complete Quest: Raw Materials
Complete Quest: Refined Judgment
From the first moment, I knew you'd prove to be an excellent addition to our community.\n\nTrust is the foundation for everything we do here.
It may seem insignificant, but I assure you that gathering and refining materials is the lifeblood of the First Light settlement.
Gather and refine the materials requested by Constable Oakes. Report back to her in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
Gather {itemName} by Mining Boulders
Gather {itemName} by Skinning Boars and Wolves
Gather {itemName} from Bushes or Trees
Craft {itemName} at Woodshop
Craft {itemName} at Stonecutting Table
Craft {itemName} at Tannery
Finely Crafted
"Just point me in the right direction."

Of course. In addition to your other fine... attributes, you seem to be good with your hands, and we could use more of that. \n\nTake these materials to Ji-hoon Kim, our resident Artificer. He'll show you what to do.
Did you talk to Artificer Kim? He usually spends his time near the Woodshop to the south.
Ah, {playerName}! It is very nice to meet you. If Sylvia believes you are good people, then that is good enough for me.
Speak with Artificer Kim in the First Light Settlement.
Forging Ahead
"That makes sense."

I've always thought so, and if rumors about a surge in Corruption are to be believed, the settlement will need to increase its weapon stores. \n\nIf you want to contribute to our defenses, this is one way you can do so.
"Yes. I want to learn."
Then I shall teach you how to forge a simple blade.\n\nTake this satchel of ore, open it and smelt the ore into ingots. Then, take up the hammer and make yourself a sword.
Open the satchel of iron ore, melt the ore into ingots, then visit the forge.
Visit the forge and craft an Iron Longsword. Talk to Artificer Kim in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
Well, what have we here? A fine blade indeed! \n\nI see the makings of an artisan in this already. Well done!
Gather Iron Ore
Craft {itemName}s at the Smelter
Craft an Iron Longsword at the Forge
Man About Town
"I hope that's a good thing."
I do too. You know who you should speak with? Albert Riches - our resident Survivalist, but... so much more than that.\n\nYes. You should go introduce yourself.
Survivalist Riches should still be at his bench next to the ship. I think you two will get along.
Talk to Survivalist Riches in the First Light Settlement.
Here's an intrepid young soul if ever I've seen one. \n\nA coincidence you show up on the same day as the Shattered Mountain erupts? I think not.
What it Takes
"That's always a good idea."
It is, isn't it? But here's a question for you, friend. \n\nIf this place comes crashing down, how do you see yourself handling it?
"I'll do what I can."
Exactly. You survive. You go on. But do you have what it takes?\n\n Let's find out. What say you set yourself a camp outside these walls and hunt some wolves from the local dens. I'd like to see it.
Those wolves aren't going to hunt themselves, friend. \n\nHowling Falls is to the northwest, just west of Hatchburg Fishery, and Fullmoon Den is to the southeast, out toward the beach.
Face down the wolves in Howling Falls and Fullmoon Den, and set up a Camp in the wilds. Talk to Survivalist Riches in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
Defeat {targetName} to collect {itemName}
Make camp to set a respawn point in the wild (default: [Y])
Here comes someone with a little swagger. And something from those wolves too, I suspect. \n\nYes, this one's got what it takes, sure enough. I had a feeling that would be the case.
Collect musk from the wolves of {POITags}
Slay {targetName} for {itemName}
Continue to {POITags} in search of the finest of furs
(Optional) Place the musk to lure out the Alpha of Howling Falls Den
Slay {targetName}
Survive the wolves' assault and claim {itemName} from {targetName}
Place the musk to lure the alpha
Hold out against the guardians of the Howling Falls Den
Intermission
Defeat Greytooth
Rumors and Reactions
"That seems to be a common sentiment."
As it should be. If Magistrate Bond has heard about these 'breaches', she'll be half-mad with worry. Go ask if you can help. \n\nDon't be a stranger, though. I'll want to speak to you again.
There you are! I was starting to worry.\n\nHave you heard these rumors of 'corruption breaches' opening up everywhere?
"Survivalist Riches told me."
Of course. He probably 'foresaw' all this. That man is touched, I tell you.
Speak to Magistrate Bond when you have time, and if you leave the settlement, watch your back out there.
Speak to Magistrate Bond in the First Light Settlement.
New Alliances
"Where can we find more support?"
You've surely noticed by now the presence of the Marauders, the Syndicate, and the Covenant in town.\n\nRecently, these groups have become quite influential.
"We should talk to them."

You're right, of course, whether the Constable approves or not.\n\nAfter you speak with them, you'll have to choose for yourself which one will make the best ally. Oh, and do make sure to check in with me again afterwards.
Speak with the Marauders
Speak with the Syndicate
Speak with the Covenant
Consult with the Magistrate
Speak with all three Faction Representatives
Perfect timing. I do hope you have spoken with the faction representatives. \n\nI'm interested to hear which of them has earned your allegiance.
Meet with each of the three factions and decide which is best.
Meet with each faction's representative in the First Light Settlement to decide which faction you wish to join.
Marauder Initiation: Hatchburg Fishery
"What kind of reward?"
The kind that will make you stronger, smarter, and faster. You carry yourself like one who is no stranger to conflict.\n\nBut I wonder if you would dare to accept my challenge.
"I will accept the challenge."
Good. The Lakecast of Hatchburg are vile, wretched creatures.\n\nReturn them to the mud and seize whatever treasures they keep there. To the victor go the spoils!
Do not doubt your abilities. Find the fortitude inside and prove your worth! This is something only you can do.
Explore Hatchburg Fishery and prove your worth to the Marauders through combat and the treasure you recover. Talk to Commander Edwin in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
Defeat {targetName} Withered
Collect {itemName}

string.comment: itemName = "Silver Flask" , targetName = "Lakecast Retcher" , POI = "Hatchburg Fishery"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Collect {itemName} from {targetName}
Excelsior, my friend! You have proven your mettle this day.\n\nYou will make a fine addition to the ranks of the Marauders.
Syndicate Initiation: Dayspring Mills
"I'm up for a challenge."
We will see, won't we? You have joined the Syndicate because you do not wish to spend eternity wallowing in ignorance.\n\nThe only question that remains is whether you have stomach for it.
"The stomach for what?"
The truth, of course, and the price it demands.\n\nOne of our number failed in Dayspring Mills, and many research notes were lost. Recover them and we will talk.
Search chests for {itemName} in {POITags}
You've got the notes? Let's see them. \n\nYesâ€¦yes! Using these, we can recreate our experiments.
"What kind of experiments?"
Oh, you will learn soon enough.\n\nYes, I believe you will be a fine addition to our circle.
Alchemists carry the burden of truth, a responsibility for knowledge. \n\nRecover our research notes from Dayspring Mills.
Explore Dayspring Mills and prove yourself to the Syndicate by recovering the abandoned research notes. Talk to Alchemist Long in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
Covenant Initiation: Hilltop Encampment
"I swear to protect the Spark."
And so you shall! I see the light in your eyes, the yearning for meaning and righteousness.\n\nYou have sworn, but now we must be certain you have the will to back your promise.
"I am to be tested?"

Yes. We are all tested every day, and soon enough, the Corruption will be coming. That will be the true test.\n\nFirst though, prove you have the conviction to stand against the Gristlerot of Hilltop Encampment.
Defeat {targetName} Corrupted
Search containers for {itemName}s at {POITags}

string.comment: itemName = "Tainted Flesh" , targetName = "Gristlerot Skinner" , POI = "Hilltop Encampment"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Recover {itemName} from {targetName}s in {POITags}
By the Spark, I wish I could charge into battle at your side. But my duty is here, and here, I will stay.
Yes, yes, I had faith you would return. Conviction such as yours is unshakeable.\n\nDestiny has called you to serve in our cause. There is not a doubt in my mind.
Cleanse the Hilltop Encampment of Gristlerot Corrupted, and retrieve any supplies you find. Talk to Adjudicator Jeffrey in the First Light Settlement when your task is done.
Join the Marauders\n OR
Join the Syndicate\n OR
Join the Covenant
Very well. Only time will tell whether you've made the right choice.\n\nBut I'm of no mind to judge. The settlement needs assistance from whichever faction will give it.
I cannot make this decision for you.
Decide which Faction you wish to join, and then speak to the appropriate Faction Representative to enlist.
Choose Your Allegiance
[BLANK]
Talk to your Faction Representative and Select a Mission
Complete a Faction Mission and report back the Magistrate
Well, {playerName}, I've been hearing good things about you and your new friends. \n\nI think you chose well in your allegiance.
[BLANK]
Speak to your Faction Representative to view and accept a Faction Mission. Once the mission is complete, return to Magistrate Bond.
Commitment to the Cause
[BLANK]
Encroaching Corruption
Scour the areas near the First Light Settlement and destroy any Corruption nodules you find. Then report back to Constable Oakes in the Settlement.
N/A
N/A
N/A
Consult with Constable Oakes for an update on Corruption
Excellent timing. I was just about to dispatch someone to find out what had become of you.\n\nWere the reports true then? Pockets of Corruption manifesting closer to the settlement?
"Yes, but I destroyed them."

Well done. You've bought us more time, at the very least. Be careful now, lest I come to depend on you.\n\nOf course, I would suggest you consider purchasing a home here. It will be much easier to return when you head out again.
"I'm heading out again?"

Possibly. Remember the old man who warned about Corruption? I've confirmed he's at a fishing shack in Monarch's Bluffs.\n\nIt's quite a journey, but a necessary one. See the Innkeep before you go - they needed a favor that way as well.
Search the listed areas and eliminate any signs of Corruption:
North of Hatchburg
Near the Mountain Road
On the Inlet Shoreline
Dayspring Barley
"I'm sure it's not personal."
But it is! 'What can that daft barkeep contribute?' That's what they're saying.\n\nIt's not right. I got feelings too, you know?
"There must be a way."
Maybe. I've been thinking of making a special brew. \n\nThere's barley stores out in Dayspring Mills. It's good stuff. If you could get that barley, that'd be something.
If you can get that barley from Dayspring Mills, I can make a brew. I think so, at least.
Waitâ€¦ you really waded through the Withered at Dayspring Mills just for my barley?\n\nThat's raw! You gotta be some kinda tough for that. Thanks!
Travel to Dayspring Mills and gather barley from the fields
Gather {itemName} in {POITags}
Retrieve the abandoned Heirlooms from Dayspring Mills. Talk to Barkeep Rost in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
Hilltop Hops
"It was my pleasure."

string.comment: male referring to male (Chef Paul Giroux - corrupted chef)
string.speaker: Barkeep Rost - First Light
string.name: BarkeepRost

resources.string: So... I hope it don't seem like I'm imposing if I ask one more teency-weency favor. \n\nThing is, my brewing recipeâ€¦ well, it's just not well-suited to this amazing barley.
"How can I help?"

string.comment: male referring to male (Chef Paul Giroux - corrupted chef)
string.speaker: Barkeep Rost - First Light
string.name: BarkeepRost

resources.string: There was this Chef Giroux in Hilltop had the most amazing recipe. Hilltop's gone to the Corrupted now. \n\nBut if I could get that brew recipe and some Hilltop Hops, that would be likeâ€¦ the best thing ever.
Travel to the Hilltop Encampment and recover the Hops and Brews

string.comment: itemName = "Sack of Hilltop Hops" POI = "Hilltop Encampment"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Gather {itemName} in {POITags}

string.comment: itemName = "Girouxs Brew Recipe" , targetName = "Chef Paul Giroux" , POI = "Hilltop Encampment"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Recover {itemName} from {targetName} in {POITags}
You're a real pal. The Hilltop Encampment is just up the mountain past Dayspring Mills. Go right at the fork, can't miss it.

string.comment: male referring to male (Chef Paul Giroux - corrupted chef)
string.speaker: Barkeep Rost - First Light
string.name: BarkeepRost

resources.string: No wayâ€¦ no way! You really went up to Hilltop and got me the recipe and the hops?\n\nLet me see! I gotta brew some of this up right away!
"Here you go."
Oh no! This stuff doesn't mix at all! Some kinda residue on it! What a bummer! Maybe I'll ask Artificer Kimâ€¦ if he has time for me. \n\nDon't mean to complain thoughâ€¦ not after what you've done.
Recover Chef Giroux's Brew Recipe from Hilltop Encampment, and some infamous Hilltop Hops. Talk to Barkeep Rost in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
Powder Kegs
"We'll do our best."

Fair enough, but I'll let you in on a little secret - I had a dream, and it gave me a plan for the settlement's defense - a foolproof plan.\n\nSome people might call it crazy, but I think you might be up for it.
"Tell me about your plan."
Alright then. We dig a trench around the settlement and fill it with gunpowder. Corrupted comeâ€¦ BOOM! \n\nYour part is just procuring the powder from the stores at Dayspring Mills. What do you say?
Travel to Dayspring Mills and find the abandoned Powder Kegs
Collect {itemName}
Destroy {targetName} Withered
Dayspring Mills is to the north, the large farming village. Get that gunpowder and I'll do the rest.
There's my co-conspirator. Yep, this will do the trick just fine. Good work. \n\nLet's just keep this plan between us for now. No need to ruffle any feathers.
Reduce the number of Harvestbane Withered in Dayspring Mills, and recover the stored gunpowder. Talk to Survivalist Riches in the First Light Settlement when your task is done.
Siege Mentality
"I suppose that can be frustrating."

Of course. I am no fool, you know. I know what they're saying, but I must be guided by my conscience.\n\nRight now, it's telling me that first priority is to ensure that come what may, we can keep people fed.
"Is there anything I can do?"

There is. Long ago, the people of Forellac seeded their lakes with amazing fish - one fish will feed hundreds.\n\nIf we had enough fish and the charcoal to cook it, I would sleep a lot easier at night.
In Letum's Pick:
In Forellac:

string.comment: itemName = "Batches of Charcoal" , targetName = "Ironslag" , POI = "Letums Pick"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Collect {itemName} from {targetName} Corrupted
Gather {itemName} from abandoned Fish Traps
Eliminate the {targetName} Withered throughout the village
Well now, that was fast! â€¦Oh, silly me. You haven't been yet. Fish from Forellac, charcoal from Letum's Pick.
I can't tell you what a relief this is. These supplies will keep us fed, and that is no small thing. \n\nYou are a good citizen and a... loyal friend.
Collect Batches of Charcoal from Ironslag Corrupted at Letum's Pick, and recover Jerked Fish from Forellac. Talk to Constable Oakes in the First Light Settlement when your task is done.
In the Walls
"Is there anything you need help with?"
Yes. The critical thing is that we work together to ensure our health and our safety.\n\nOakes is focused on procuring supplies for a siege, but that's only useful if the walls hold.
"Are the walls strong enough?"
The timber is sound, but the iron bindings are many decades old and rusted.\n\nIf you could mine some magnetite from Letum's Pick, I can reinforce the walls.
Seek out the Magnetite deposits within {POITags}
Gather {itemName}s from Magnetite deposits in {POITags}
Destroy the {targetName} miners
Magnetite. Letum's Pick. Be careful out there.
Excellent. I felt certain you would come through. \n\nWith this magnetite, I can make the walls holdâ€¦ even if there happened to be an 'explosion' nearby.
Gather chunks of Magnetite from Letum's Pick. Talk to Artificer Kim in the First Light Settlement when your task is done.
Unsolved Mysteries
"You think she's failing as a leader?"

It certainly seems that way. I've had my suspicions about Sylvia for some time. She was Constable when First Light fell from grace. \n\nWe had an alliance with Nyhart's Anchorage, then one day, it all fell to the Lost.
"What happened?"

Hmmph! It's a mystery! But Constable Oakes knew more than she let on.\n\nYou'll help me investigate the matter, won't you? Clearwater Bend and Campbell's Rest were the first to fall. Check there for clues.
Investigate Clearwater Bend for clues as to the fate of the inhabitants
Investigate Campbell's Rest for clues as to the fate of the inhabitants
You should be on your way to Clearwater Bend and Campbell's Rest. This is important.
Thank goodness you've returned. Let's see what you've uncovered.\n\nHmm. These writings suggest the towns fell only after Nyhart's Anchorage. That's not the story we were told.
Determine the fate of the inhabitants of Clearwater Bend and Campbell's Rest. Talk to Magistrate Bond in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
Hypothetical Explorations
"It was simple enough."
Gunter is not the brightest torch, but I help him when I can.\n\nThe failure of his new brew recipe is most perplexing, however.
"Could it be the ingredients?"

Indeed, what if it's because the barley and hops come from place overrun by the Lost and Corrupted?\nWe must experiment! If you can get samples from Corrupted and Withered specimens, I will do the rest.
Travel to {POITags} and obtain blood samples from the Gristlerot Corrupted
Travel to {POITags} and harvest flesh from the Skipstitch Withered

string.comment: itemName = "Vial of Corrupted Blood" , targetName = "Gristlerot" , POI = "Hilltop Encampment"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Obtain {itemName} from {targetName} at {POITags}

string.comment: itemName = "Hunk of Withered Flesh" , targetName = "Skipstitch" , POI = "Campbells Rest"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Obtain {itemName} from {targetName} at {POITags}
For some reason, I can't get this matter out of my head. Please get those samples from the Corrupted at Hilltop Encampment and the Withered in Campbell's Rest.
Splendid! These samples will do perfectly.\n\nThe possibilities here are truly fascinating.

Obtain blood samples from the Gristlerot Corrupted at the Hilltop Encampment, and flesh of the Skipstitch Withered from Campbell's Rest. Talk to Artificer Kim in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
Nyhart's Anchorage
"You think we should investigate further?"
I certainly do! The alliance with Nyhart's was never perfect, but it made the territory safer.\n\nI never understood why Sylvia wasn't more disturbed when the Anchorage was overrun by the Lost.
"You think she was involved?"

One thing living for centuries teaches you is that people are capable of anything, Corrupted or not.\n\nThe only way to be sure is for you to go to Nyhart's and look for clues. And be discreet about it.
Investigate {POITags} for any clues about the Pirates' past plans
Recover clues from {targetName} Pirates in {POITags}
Investigate the supplies in the docked ship's hold
Return when you've finished investigating what happened at Nyhart's Anchorage.
Oh dear, it's about time you've returned. Let's see what you've found.\n\nGreat scott! Those damned pirates were planning to set sail, to leave Aeternum!
"How could they do that?"

That's what I'd like to know! They planned to set sail right after the return of the expedition into the ruins of Saircor.\n\nNow that is very interesting. Our Constable was the one who organized that expedition!
Investigate what proceeded the fall of Nyhart's Anchorage to the Lost. Talk to Magistrate Bond in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
One Threat at a Time
"What memories are you referring to?"

string.comment: female referring to males (Anchorshot Agents Ambrose and Zebulon)
string.speaker: Constable Oakes - First Light
string.name: OverseerOakes

resources.string: We once had an alliance with Nyhart's Anchorage, butâ€¦ unfortunate events changed that. \n\nThe Lost pirates there are now a threat to our settlement's security.
"More than the Corruption?"

string.comment: female referring to males (Anchorshot Agents Ambrose and Zebulon)
string.speaker: Constable Oakes - First Light
string.name: OverseerOakes

resources.string: No, but this one, we can eliminate. I should've done so long ago. \n\nSome Lost in Nyhart's retain a measure of sentience, and dark intent. Ambrose and Zebulon - destroy them and we will be safer.
Explore {POITags} and eliminate the threat of the Pirate leaders

string.comment: targetName = "Boatswain Ambrose" and "Quartermaster Zebulon" , POI = "Nyharts Anchorage"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Eliminate {targetName}

string.comment: female referring to males (Anchorshot Agents Ambrose and Zebulon)
string.speaker: Constable Oakes - First Light
string.name: OverseerOakes

resources.string: The Lost in Nyhart's Anchorage may not be as dangerous as the Corruption, but they are a threat all the same.
It's done then? Ambrose and Zebulon destroyed? Thank you.\n\nThey will return, of course, but they will lose the sentience that made them dangerous.
Defeat Ambrose and Zebulon at Nyhart's Anchorage. Talk to Constable Oakes at the First Light Settlement when the foes are vanquished.
Something Significant
"What exactly is your theory?"
I'll explain as soon as I can actually test it. There is one problem, however. \n\nThe Withered samples from Campbell's Rest seem to be too weak, possibly from deterioration.
"Should I gather more?"
Indeed, I hoped you might volunteer. This time however, try another location. \n\nPerhaps samples from from the Lost pirates at Nyhart's Anchorage will not deteriorate so quickly.
Journey to {POITags} and obtain vials of Pirate blood

string.comment: itemName = "Vial of Pirate Blood" , targetName = "Anchorshot" , POI = "Nyharts Anchorage"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Collect {itemName} from {targetName} Pirates at {POITags}

Just a bit more... good, yes... and now we reseal. Phew! \n\nAny trouble with the blood samples from Nyhart's Anchorage? You know they won't just outright offer to give them to you? You'll have to take them by force.
Out to Nyhart's and back unscathed. You must be a skilled combatant.\n\nI am grateful to have your help.
Obtain samples of Pirate blood from the Anchorshot Pirates of Nyhart's Anchorage. Talk to Artificer Kim in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
The Expedition into Saircor
"How can we find out the truth?"
If Sylvia and the traitors from Nyhart's were involved in the expedition to Saircor, perhaps that is why it failed.
"What happened?"

The expedition never returned. So the answers we need lie in the ruins of Saircor.\n\nThe Guardians there are fierce, but I believe in you. Find whatever remains of the expedition, including anything they went there seeking.
Travel to {POITags} and search for any evidence of the lost expedition
Journey into {POITags} and continue the work of the lost expedition
Recover the expedition notes from Saircor Bridge
Recover the expedition notes from Saircor

string.comment: itemName = "Ancient Clay Statuary" , targetName = "Tutelary Regent" , POI = Saircor
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Obtain {itemName} from {targetName} at {POITags}
The ruins of Saircor. That's where the answers lie.
To return from Saircor in one piece is no small feat.\n\nBut quickly now, let's see what you've discovered.
"Expedition Notes and a Relic."
Goodness, me! They believed the Ancients knew a way they could break through the Corruption.\n\nThis relic might even be the key!
Recover any evidence left from the expedition to Saircor as well as whatever they were seeking. Talk to Magistrate Bond in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
Skin in the Game
"That might be for the best."
I have good news though! I've been gifted with another insight and another plan.\n\nThis time I spoke with Artificer Kim in advance, and he approves.
"What's the plan?"

See, I knew you'd ask! We'll cover the settlement walls with impenetrable rawhide interlaced with the untearable cloth of the Ancients!\n\nJust need pelts from the Elder's Bluff area and cloth from the Guardians in Saircor. What do you say?
Venture into the Elder's Bluff area to begin your hunt
Explore {POITags} and search for cloth remnants of the Ancients
Collect {itemName}s from {targetName} Guardians in {POITags}
Retrieve an {itemName} from a container in {POITags}

string.comment: itemName = "Peppered Lynx Pelt" / "Brown Rabbit Pelt" , targetName = "Peppered Lynx" / "Brown Rabbit"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Gather {itemName}s from {targetName} in Elder's Bluff
The Lynx in Elder's Bluff have some of the sturdiest hides that you can find, which will make for some almost impenetrable barriers!

string.comment: male referring to male (Artificer Kim), male referring to female (Trader Vijayan)
string.speaker: Survivalist Riches - First Light
string.name: SurvivalistRiches

resources.string: Back from the wilds of Elder's Bluff and the ruins of Saircor, are you?\n\nA tougher traveler you'll not find! Yes, this cloth and these skins will do nicely!

Gather Warden Lynx and Brown Rabbit Pelts from the Elder's Bluff area, and recover Guardian Cloth Fragments and Ancient Cloth strips from Saircor. Talk to Survivalist Riches in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
Ancient Protections
"That's nice to hear."
Jihoon gave me some further ideas about our wall project as well. \n\nThe Ancient Guardians warded away harm with some kind of enchanted items.
"Where can I find them?"
There's that can-do spirit! It's contagious, isn't it?\n\nHe mentioned Crests and a Prism of some sort in the Ancient Ruins to the west. I'll get started with the cloth and pelts.
Travel to the Light's Crown region and locate the Ancient relics
Enter {POITags}
Obtain {itemName}s from {targetName} Guardians around Light's Crown
Obtain the {itemName} from a container in {POITags}
The Ancient ruins to the west - that's where we'll find the charms we need to protect our walls.
Even without channeling, I know you got everything - you always comes through.\n\nWith all this, I think we'll have the walls bound and protected in no time. Yes, indeed.

Collect Crests from the Brightbeacon Guardians throughout Light's Crown, and search for Crystalline Prisms in Elafry Pyrgo. Talk to Survivalist Riches in the First Light Settlement when your task is complete.
The Next Threat
"You're going to ask for something else, aren't you?"
Indeed, I am compelled to ask your help in addressing another threat to our safety here.\n\nI am confident that by eliminating these dangers, we will have a better chance of fighting the Corruption.
"I will help gladly."
The Guardians to the west threaten our supply lines from Cutlass Keys.\n\nEliminate the Regent and Taskmaster in the ruins, and our western roads will be safe again.
Venture into {POITags} and seek out the Ancient threats
Defeat the {targetName} in {POITags}
Search for the 'Approaching the Tower' journal entry
Search for the 'The Empty Hall' journal entry
Search for the 'Sphaera Memoriae' journal entry
The leaders of the Ancient Guardians in Elafry Pyrgo threaten our supplies lines to the west. They must be dealt with.
Well done. I wonder, were you such a hero in the Old World? \n\nOr has this side of you only become apparent in Aeternum? Either way, I am grateful.
Eliminate the Brightbeacon Taskmaster and Brightbeacon Regent at Elafry Pyrgo. Talk to Constable Oakes in the First Light Settlement when the foes are defeated.
Truth and Consequences
"Does it bother you?"
It does. I have nothing to hide, but I do have regrets.\n\nThe fall of Nyhart's and our alliance was so dark and twisted, I fear I have avoided learning the whole truth.
"It's not too late."

I know, and now is the time. I believe the Captain in charge of Coffman's Redoubt instigated somethingâ€¦ unthinkable.\n\nPlease go to Coffman's and find out where the clues lead. Tell no one about thisâ€¦ for now.
Locate the end of the footprint trail
Follow the footprints on the road south of Letum's Pick
Search Letum's Pick for evidence of foul play
Travel to {POITags} and retrieve the Captain's Orders
Travel to {POITags} and search for evidence of foul play
Collect {itemName} from {targetName} Pirates
Search for the 'The Rigger's Plea' journal entry
Start at Coffman's Redoubt and follow the clues. Whatever horror occurred back then, we must now face it so that we can move forward.
I'm glad to see you, but honestly, I dreaded your return. \n\nThe Captain and I had arranged for all our people to flee Aeternum together, but I refrained from telling the citizens here.
I didn't want to raise their hopes. And I was right. \n\nThe Saircor expedition was a failure. As these orders indicate, it was then the Captain resorted to extreme measures. But where did they go?
"Why not tell them?"
Oh dear, for the love of all things! Why, why did it have to be there? \n\nThis is exactly what I feared.
"A place called Sleepy Tallow."

Retrieve the Captain's Orders from the Cannonstorm Pirates of Coffman's Redoubt and follow the clues to find out where they went. Talk to Constable Oakes in the First Light Settlement when the task is complete.
Bond's Gambit
"Have you learned anything new?"

string.comment: male referring to male (Captain Karj Coffman - pirate captain)
string.speaker: Magistrate Bond - First Light
string.name: MagistrateBond

resources.string: I have. Keep this quiet, but I've been poking around since we last spoke.\n\nI fear the welfare of our settlement may be in serious jeopardy.
"Then we must act."

string.comment: male referring to male (Captain Karj Coffman - pirate captain)
string.speaker: Magistrate Bond - First Light
string.name: MagistrateBond

resources.string: With the research and relics from Saircor, I believe we can indeed sail away. The only threat is the Lost pirates in Coffman's Redoubt.\n\nIf you can sabotage the cannons up there, you'll be clearing the path for our escape.
Travel to {POITags} and destroy the Pirate Cannons
Sabotage the Cannons

string.comment: male referring to male (Captain Karj Coffman - pirate captain)
string.speaker: Magistrate Bond - First Light
string.name: MagistrateBond

resources.string: Do whatever you must to sabotage the cannons in Coffman's redoubt. This may be our only hope.

string.comment: male referring to female (Magistrate Bond), male referring to female (Trader Vijayan)
string.speaker: Magistrate Bond - First Light
string.name: MagistrateBond

resources.string: I've begun quietly making arrangements for our departure.\n\nYou said the ship is stocked, so there's just the cannons. Tell me you got them.
"They've been disabled."

string.comment: male referring to female (Magistrate Bond), male referring to female (Trader Vijayan)
string.speaker: Magistrate Bond - First Light
string.name: MagistrateBond

resources.string: Oh goodness, but this is so exciting!\n\nDon't tell anyone anything! I will let you know when our plans are in place.
Eliminate Cannonstorm Pirates at Coffman's Redoubt, and sabotage their cannons. Talk to Magistrate Bond in the First Light Settlement when the task is complete.
Curse of the Ebony Hawk
"We need to know the truth."

string.comment: female referring to male (dead sailor - Stormstruck Phantasm)
string.speaker: Constable Oakes - First Light
string.name: OverseerOakes

resources.string: I know. Sleepy Tallow has always been a place of darkness for centuries. Their purpose there was undoubtedly dark as well.\n\nI hesitate to ask, but please, go back to Sleepy Tallow and find out how this ended.
Seek out {POITags} and uncover the story of the Ebony Hawk
Investigate the strange story of Sleepy Tallow
Kill {targetName} Faminegeists in {POITags}
Search for a journal entry about the dark events of Sleepy Tallow
Continue searching for another crewman's letter

string.comment: itemName = "Sailors Locket" , targetName = "Ebony Wolf" , POI = "Sleepy Tallow"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Retrieve {itemName}s from {targetName} in {POITags}
Find the Captain's journal and complete the story of the Ebony Hawk
Destroy the {targetName}
The mystery leads to the town of Sleepy Tallow. It is there and only there that we will find our answers.
You look rather pale, {playerName}. I would make a joke about seeing ghosts, but of course, it wouldn't be a joke.\n\nTell me - did you uncover the truth of what happened?
"These pages tell the story."
Thisâ€¦ this is even worse than what I feared. In desperation, people can truly be capable of unthinkable things.\n\nI'm sorry this story had to even come to light.
Solve the mystery of Sleepy Tallow. Talk to Constable Oakes in the First Light Settlement when the task is complete.
It's all about Ectoplasm
"This could make a big difference."
And I'm starting to think it will! Our experiments have yielded results.\n\nWe have proven that whatever energies course through the veins of the Lost, it is resistant to the Corruption.
"How can we put it to use?"

I have an idea - the most potent forms of the Lost in First Light are the Faminegeists of Sleepy Tallow. \n\nThe geists' Ectoplasm is just the thing. Get us some of that, and we'll use it to bolster the settlement's defenses!
Travel to {POITags} and collect ectoplasm from the Faminegeists

string.comment: itemName = "Ghostly Ectoplasm" , targetName = "Ebony Hawk" , POI = "Sleepy Tallow"
string.speaker: UI

resources.string: Collect {itemName} from {targetName} Faminegeists
Ectoplasm from the geists in Sleepy Tallow. We're close now!
Aha, a momentous occasion! You have done well. Very well. \n\nWe will spread this Ectoplasm across the barriers Albert Riches is making. Our settlement will be safe from the Corruption.
Obtain samples of ectoplasm from the Ebony Hawk Faminegeists haunting Sleepy Tallow. Talk to Artificer Kim in the First Light Settlement when the task is complete.
Standing Down
"I agree. Magistrate Bond in particular."
Indeed. I made a mistake trying to keep the truth from everyone, and myself, frankly.\n\nDemoralizing as it may be, she deserves to know what happened.
"I can take it to her."
Yes, I think that's wise. She trusts you, {playerName}, as do I.\n\nShow her the documents, and ensure she realizes it's time to stand down.
I appreciate you being the one to share these with Magistrate Bond.\n\nI'm glad that you, at least, still have her trust.
{playerName}! It's about time.\n\nI understand you've been speaking with Constable Oakes. Tell me - did you learn anything?
"You should read this."

Oh, should I? Let's seeâ€¦ goodness gracious! This is appalling? How dare heâ€¦?\n\nI suppose this means Oakes had only good intentions, after all. Very well, I was having doubts about our 'escape plan,' anyways.
Take the documents from Sleepy Tallow and show them to Magistrate Bond in the First Light Settlement so she will stand down on her plans.
Drinks on Me
"Barkeep Rost deserves all the credit."
Ah, courage and humility! That's kind of you to say. I suspect Gunter would be surprised to learn the results of his inquiries.\n\nIt's true. None of this would've happened without him.
"Should I tell him?"
Yes, our barkeep has immense respect for you.\n\nIt will mean that much more, and of course, drinks are on me!
Tell Gunter the news. I know he'll be quite happy to hear it.
Oh, {playerName}, it's so good to see you! \n\nI was just thinking about my brew recipe. Such a disappointment.
"Actually, it helped defend against Corruption."
It did? Get outta here, really? I guess I did do my part then, didn't I?\n\nYou and me both, saving the settlement, like heroes. Yeah, I like the sound of that.
Tell Barkeep Gunter Rost in First Light about how his brew recipe wound up helping defend the settlement.
Between Innkeeps
"I'm the venturing type."
Perfect! Innkeep Biton over in Monarch's Bluffs owes me - I loaned him some azoth a while back.\n\nIf you'll go remind him of the debt, he'll pay the cost for you to fast travel back.
"Fast travel back?"
Well yeah. It just costs a little azothâ€¦ like everything else, right?\n\nBut yes, if you will remind Innkeep Biton of the debt and return, I'll give you a little azoth myself.
I do appreciate you taking my request to Innkeep Biton.\n\nHe'll give you enough azoth to fast travel back.
Greetings and welcome to Monarch's Bluffs! Wait, do I know you?\n\nOr have you come from First Light? I had a feeling Fairfax would send someone soon.
"Yes, she wants her azoth."

And you can assure her that I will send it shortly. We've had an influx of new arrivals lately.\n\nAnd of course, before you askâ€¦ here is enough azoth for you to fast travel back to First Light. Godspeed!
Remind Innkeep Biton in Monarch's Bluffs of the debt he owes Innkeep Fairfax in First Light.
Fast Travel Home
[BLANK]
Open the Map and (optional) Fast Travel to First Light
Well now, that was quicker than I expected.\n\nTell me that rapscallion has the azoth he owes meâ€¦
"He says he'll send it soon."
He'd better, or I'll be sending you back!\n\nI appreciate you going all the way out there, {playerName}. As promised, here's a little more azoth. Oh, and you can keep your free room!
[BLANK}
Open your map and use the azoth from the Innkeep to fast travel back to the First Light Settlement.
